item.title: Using your project docs inside the application

description.p: The applications I work on have markdown docs. These can be in the docs/ folder for example asdocs/webhooks.md

But some of these docs have value to the user of the UI not just the developer, and when we include these docs inside the application repo it is a TON easier to just update them as you fix and make new features in the codebase.
You can have the best of both worlds with a simple to use libraryhttps://github.com/michelf/php-markdown
This then allows me, in my controllers to get some content from these docs, for example

pre.code:
<?php
namespace App\Http\Controllers;
use App\Http\Requests;
use Michelf\MarkdownExtra;
class HelpController extends Controller
{
public function api()
{
$text = file_get_contents(base_path(‘docs/webhooks.md’));
$webhooks = MarkdownExtra::defaultTransform($text); return view('help.api', compact('webhooks'));
}
}
